title: US Space Force Unveils New Mission Statement
summary: The US Space Force in an effort to provide a clearer and more concise understanding of its mission has unveiled a new mission statement today. "Secure our nation's interests in, from, and to space"

title: NASA's Oxygen-Generating Experiment MOXIE Completes Mars Mission
summary: Riding with the Perseverance rover, the instrument has proved to be a viable technology for astronauts on Mars to produce oxygen for fuel and breathing.

title: MAG Aerospace and SAS partner for Space Force data-analytics contract
summary: MAG Aerospace is partnering with artificial intelligence specialist SAS to compete for U.S. Space Force data analytics contracts, the companies announced Sept. 6

title: SpaceX stacks Ship 25 and Booster 9, prepares for flight
summary: SpaceX has rolled out Ship 25 to the launch site and stacked it on top of Super Heavy Booster 9, bringing back a fully stacked Starship rocket to Starbase since April 20.

title: Space Force rewrites mission statement
summary: The new mission statement — “To secure our nation’s interests in, from, and to space” — was crowdsourced from service members

title: Stand up, Space Greta
summary: Climate activist Greta Thunberg's impact on the environmental movement has sparked a call for a similar advocate in the field of space sustainability. While finding another Greta is a tall order, the space sector is seeing a surge in young professionals passionate about the sustainability of space and its connection to Earth's well-being.

title: SpaceX Almost Ready For Second Starship Launch, Integrates Vehicle
summary: On Tuesday September 5th at 2:20pm, SpaceX integrated Starship 25 on top Super Heavy Booster 9 at the orbital launch pad in Starbase, Texas.

title: Space Development Agency solicits bids for 54 missile-tracking satellites
summary: The Space Development Agency on Sept. 5 released a solicitation for 54 satellites equipped with infrared sensors capable of tracking hypersonic missiles in all phases of flight.

title: Starship is stacked and ready to make its second launch attempt
summary: During this test flight, Starship will carry no payloads.

title: Ariane 6 Core Stage Breathes Fire for the First Time
summary:
ESA, the French Space Agency CNES, and project prime ArianeGroup completed the first shot hot fire test of an Ariane 6 core stage. The test was completed in the late afternoon on 5 September from the Ariane 6 ELA4 launch complex of the Guiana Space Centre. The testing involved a full launch sequence and final […]
The post Ariane 6 Core Stage Breathes Fire for the First Time appeared first on European Spaceflight.
